text:
Hi all :slightly_smiling_face:!
Hi, When i create a contact (via upsert/create/update), can i also provide a companyId to do the assosiation?

Else, I need to waste another call to make the link (“Add contact to company” api)

<@U0227GH7A7M> Hi Tomer, Assuming you want full control over which company record is associated to the contact record, I think you'll need a separate API call to handle the association. Alternatively, you could consider this feature which automatically associates a contact record with a company record based on email domain: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/crm-setup/automatically-create-and-associate-companies-with-contacts>
I've not used it personally, but looks like it might be helpful.

Hello everyone,

I have two portals and I would like to synchronize some contacts between these two portals.
That it is the information of contact but also the activities of these last ones (engagements can be?). For example, a form submission.

Have you already realized this problem? Should I create a HubSpot application/integration? Or can I just use a tool like Zapier/Integromat to solve my problem?

Thanks & have a nice day,
Antoine,

Hi everyone HubSpot’s product team is exploring ways to *add app settings to the HubSpot UI for Marketplace-listed apps*. If this would benefit your app, we’d love to hear from you and discuss your use case. Please DM me if you’re interested!
• What: 45 minute call to discuss app settings
• When: calls will be scheduled over the next 1-2 weeks

Hello. Is there an endpoint to get info about the portal owner or the portal itself?
Stuff like name, phone number, email.
<@UD53A9UUR> how do i go about getting the engagements associated with an object and is there a way to filter this down just to attachments
I have a situation where my portal is showing me API responses with my key as `200`, but they are actually `404` even for users that should be found. Anyone else had a similar problem?

so you’d want to do something like
```let SOME_EMAIL = encodeURIComponent("<mailto:xxxx@example.org|xxxx@example.org>");```
I’ve tried both ways… I swear this used to work as-is.
Interestingly, the portal reports the same path whether I urlquote it or not.

lol I had typoed the email. It actually works whether you quote or not, at least if `@` is your only quotable character. The portal should still not tell you that it is returning `200` when it is reporting `404`, I reckon.

Hi all! Hoping this is the right place to ask this. I’m working on integrating analytics and the chat bot on our app, which has authenticated users. I’m unclear on what’s the “correct” way to identify to the logged in user for the sake of both analytics and the chat window. Should I be calling `identify` via the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code|Tracking Code API>, or using the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversation/visitor-identification|Visitor Identification API>, or both? TIA for any help!
